title: What is happening in Libya now? - Quora

response.answer_text: What is happening in Libya 2020? Two factions are fighting in a civil war, which started in 2014. The GNA government is based in Tripoli. It is recognized by the UN. It is headed by Sarraj, who is from a Turkish family. The LNA government has control over South and East Libya. It is headed by Haftar. Currently the UN prevents the sales of arms to Libya. But that does not seem to have stopped foreign powers like France from intervening. So where do various countries side in this proxy war? The USA supports chaos and continued civil war. As long as there is continued violence, the USA can delay other countries from developing lucrative infrastructure and oil fields in Libya. That way the USA can retain its hegemony. So the USA basically supports whichever side can keep the battle going on, which currently is their puppet Haftar.Russia favors playing the two off each other because it has inked economic contracts with both sides. As such Russia sent its Wagner group militia to fight on the side of Haftar. Moreover, as long as there is continued fighting, there will be more Libyan and Muslim refugees that will flee to Europe, create chaos in Europe, and allow further Russian exploitation in Europe’s democracies, thereby weakening the EU and NATO.Turkey supports Sarraj, a fellow Turk, but also because Surraj’s government promised maritime control in the East Mediterranean, which would allow Turkey more maneuverability in the region at a time when the EU and the USA are sanctioning it. Turkey also wants to move Al-Qaida and ISIS soldiers away from Syria and its own borders to Libya. This has made Greeks in Cyprus wary of Turkey, as well as other former states under the Ottoman empire suspicious of Turkish irredentism.France does not want any more Muslim refugees and wants peace. But it has been supplying weapons to Haftar. Why Haftar? Maybe because of US pressure and good deals with Haftar. The USA thinks: ok I won’t supply weapons and violate the UN arms embargo, so I will let France supply US made weapons to Haftar instead. That way people can blame France, not the USA. https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2019/07/libya-asks-france-explain-arms-reached-haftar-forces-190712001110293.htmlItaly has opposed France’s and Turkey’s involvement in Libyan affairs. Libya is close geographically to Italy, and recently Italy has been receiving a hundreds of thousands of refugees ever since Qaddafi was overthrown by the USA and NATO. It opposes foreign countries intervening in Libya. https://www.politico.eu/article/frances-double-game-in-libya-nato-un-khalifa-haftar/Most of Europe, including Britain and Germany, seems to recognize the GNA, the official UN government. https://www.euronews.com/2019/04/08/france-under-pressure-to-condemn-haftar-as-eu-seeks-unity-on-libya-crisisThe various Arab and North African nations seem divided about which side to support, with some like Egypt supporting Haftar while others like Qatar and Sudan support Sarraj.China wants to be neutral and stay out of the messy situation in Libya. It has refused to supply arms to either side. But Sarraj has agreed to join China’s BRI to help redevelop Libya’s economy. It is unclear whether there are similar infrastructure and oil deals between China and Haftar. But if there is anything China wants, it is peace in Libya and a multilateral peace conference. It opposes any unilateral outside influence that threatens to destabilize Libya even more.What is the best outcome? A peace deal to end the fighting, one that might actually end up splitting Libya between the Tripoli and LNA governments, like how Sudan was split in 2011. This way all there will be no more Libyan refugee crisis. And all countries can continue economic and oil deals with both governments, build critical infrastructure, and live peacefully.

Tribulations is more indispensable than oil in Libya, and it is at the crescendo of a full-fledged war. Libya is on the verge of an impending war. People of Libya went berserk when they heard of Libyan National Army (LNA) approaching Tripoli, Libya. It is not only underpinned by USA and United Nations but also presided over by the Libyan Prime Minister, FAYEZ AL-SARRAJWhere as LNA, a rebel agglomeration is leaded by Libyan General,KHALIFA HAFTAR,it operates from Tobruk, Libya, and underpinned by Egypt and UAE. In 1969, he aided Muammar Al Gathafi, did a coup in contemplation of untrammeled power. In 1978, he became prisoner of war during a war between Libya and Republic of Chad, which made Gathafi turn a blind eye to him. He was incarcerated by USA, worked for CIA for 20 years, involved in a lot of plannings of assassinations of Gathafi. After the sudden debacle of Gathafi in 2011, he abruptly came back to Libya, and started to agglomerate small tribal groups. In May 2014, he launched an operation entitled “Operation Dignity” to uproot Al-queda from Benghazi. He didn’t embody the valour but also exemplified it. In 2015, Owning to his trounce over Al-queda made the house of representatives of Libya appoint him the General of LNA. In September 2016, After gaining control over LNA, he launched another operation entitled “Swift Thunder”, and grabbed back the hold of conglomerated oil terminals from the terrorists organizations. Today, he has the hold of behemoth chunks of Libya, and also zero terrorism policy against obscurantist Islamic terrorism. Differences Between GNA and LNA The gloves are off.
